intro: Calathea roseopicta, commonly known as the pink-veined calathea, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, intricately patterned leaves that display a mix of green, pink, and white hues. The plant belongs to the Marantaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Its foliage is often described as having a "velvet" texture, adding to its ornamental appeal. Calathea roseopicta requires consistently moist soil and high humidity to flourish.
